abstract: Converts a position in the framework’s local coordinate system to latitude, longitude and altitude.

declaration.code: func getGeoLocation(forPoint position: simd_float3, completionHandler: @escaping (CLLocationCoordinate2D, CLLocationDistance, (any Error)?) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

ARKit refers to its local coordinate space as “world” coordinate space, but this is different from geographic coordinates. For more information on ARKit’s coordinate space, see [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/setWorldOrigin(relativeTransform:)].

To succeed, this function requires an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARGeoTrackingConfiguration] session with state equal to [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARGeoTrackingStatus/State-swift.enum/localized].

# getGeoLocation(forPoint:completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Converts a position in the framework’s local coordinate system to latitude, longitude and altitude.

## Declaration

```swift
func getGeoLocation(forPoint position: simd_float3, completionHandler: @escaping (CLLocationCoordinate2D, CLLocationDistance, (any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
func geoLocation(forPoint position: simd_float3) async throws -> (CLLocationCoordinate2D, CLLocationDistance)
```

## Parameters

- **position**: Position in local coordinates to convert.
- **completionHandler**: Code that control will execute when this function returns. The session runs this code on its delegate queue. The parameters are:



## Discussion

ARKit refers to its local coordinate space as “world” coordinate space, but this is different from geographic coordinates. For more information on ARKit’s coordinate space, see [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/setWorldOrigin(relativeTransform:)].

To succeed, this function requires an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARGeoTrackingConfiguration] session with state equal to [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARGeoTrackingStatus/State-swift.enum/localized].
title: getGeoLocation(forPoint:completionHandler:)
